slides.title: Phase 1: Platform Demo
slides.notes:
AGENDA SECTION 1: Platform Demo (20 min)

What to Show

  • Login & Dashboard — Show the executive dashboard, project history, activity log
  • Excel-to-PDF Workflow — Upload an Excel → pick document type (Budget/Proposal/LOI) → Preview → Download
  • Budget Test — Let the team upload a file live and test it together

Talking Points

  • Phase 1 was scoped as 'Excel to Pretty PDF' and that's what we delivered
  • Three document types working: Budget Estimate, Sales Quotation, Letter of Intent
  • All branding, specs tables, Exhibit A, Exhibit B, payment terms, signature blocks — all automated
  • Natalia has been testing and providing feedback; we've been iterating in real-time
  • The platform has RBAC (role-based access) — different users see different features based on their role

Known Issues to Address Proactively

  • 'Page 8 of 7' bug — Acknowledge it, say it's a pagination fix in progress
  • Conditional UI — Some Intelligence Mode features still visible in Mirror Mode. On the fix list.
  • One-off Excel formats (Moody Center style) — Deferred, acknowledged as future work

Outstanding Action Items FROM ANC Team (call these out)

  • Matt/Jeremy: Decision tree for the checklist estimator — still waiting
  • Natalia: Finishing layout testing across all document types
  • Team: Any edge-case Excel files that break the parser

slides.title: Phase 2: RFP Intelligence
slides.notes:
AGENDA SECTION 2: Phase 2 Proposal (15 min)

The Setup (Use the unionagain demo as your opener)

Last night you 'accidentally' ran one of Natalia's proposals through an AI intelligence tool. It found:

  • COVID-era language that needs to be removed from boilerplate
  • Electrical pricing that may be above market rate
  • Full competitive analysis against Daktronics, SNA Displays, Samsung
  • Client research on unionagain / Union Station

Natalia's reaction: 'oh thats very cool... yes covid language has to go... ill look into electrical... thank you for sharing!'

She then said: 'I would bring that up tomorrow as phase 2 for sure. Bring this example as what the report will look like.'

Pricing to Present

  • Total Development: $4,500
  • AI Processing Costs (pass-through, not your fee): ~$100-300/month usage-based
  • Timeline: 3 weeks

The 'What This Replaces' Pitch

Senior estimator reads 500-page RFP manually (8-12 hours) ➡️ System extracts all screens in 15 minutes.
Estimator manually searches product catalog per screen (2 hours) ➡️ Auto-matched in seconds.

slides.title: Working Session
slides.subtitle: Jeremy, Matt, Jack, Eric, Jireh
slides.notes:
AGENDA SECTION 3: Working Session

Your Role Here

This is THEIR session to brainstorm, but you should steer the conversation toward:

  1. The Main Pain Point — the manual typing cycle. 'Type LED screens from PDF/Word into Excel → make Excel for manufacturer → make Excel for electrician → type back received info.' Get the estimators to confirm and expand on this pain.
  2. Priority Features — Let them rank what matters most. Use this to lock in Phase 2 scope.
  3. Data Collection Commitments — Get verbal commitments (with dates) for:
    - Matt will deliver the decision tree
    - Jeremy can provide sample RFPs
    - Eric can share the product catalog
    - Jireh can pull the 20 Excel examples

Questions to Ask the Room

  • 'What's the single task that takes you the most time on every project?'
  • 'If you could automate one thing tomorrow, what would it be?'
  • 'How many RFPs are you processing per month right now?'
  • 'What does the ideal output look like when you send specs to LG or the electrician?'
